Chapter I

It was a super hot evening in July when a young guy stepped out of his tiny room in S. Place. He moved slowly, kinda unsure, towards K. bridge. 

He had managed to dodge his landlady on the stairs. His room was basically a cupboard under the roof of a tall five-story building. The landlady lived below him and every time he left, he had to walk past her kitchen, which was always open. Each time he passed, he felt sick and scared, making him frown and feel embarrassed. He was deep in debt to her and didn’t want to run into her.

It wasn’t that he was a coward; actually, it was the opposite. Lately, he’d been in a really tense and irritable state, almost like he was overthinking everything. He had become so wrapped up in his own thoughts and isolated from others that he dreaded running into not just his landlady, but anyone. 

He was weighed down by poverty, but the stress of it all didn’t bother him as much anymore. He had stopped caring about practical stuff and lost all motivation to deal with it. Nothing his landlady could do scared him anymore. But to be...

**PAGE SUMMARY:** A young man, burdened by debt and isolation, hesitates to leave his cramped garret, fearing encounters with his landlady and others.
